name: PINNACLE HEALTH HOSPITALS, Successor by Consolidation to Polyclinic Medical Center, Petitioner, v. DAUPHIN COUNTY BOARD OF ASSESSMENT APPEALS, County of Dauphin, School District of the City of Harrisburg, City of Harrisburg, Cross-Petitioner
name_abbreviation: Pinnacle Health Hospitals v. Dauphin County Board of Assessment Appeals
docket_number: Petitions Nos. 0151-0152 Middle District Allocatur Docket 1998

parties: PINNACLE HEALTH HOSPITALS, Successor by Consolidation to Polyclinic Medical Center, Petitioner, v. DAUPHIN COUNTY BOARD OF ASSESSMENT APPEALS, County of Dauphin, School District of the City of Harrisburg, City of Harrisburg, Cross-Petitioner.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 7th day of August, 1998, the Petitions for Allowance of Appeal are granted, limited to the following issue:
Does Polyclinic Medical Center operate entirely free from private profit motive as required by Hospital Utilization Project v. Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, 507 Pa. 1, 487 A.2d 1306 (1985), for purposes of tax-exempt status?
This case is consolidated with Wilson Area School Distr., et al. v. Easton Hospital, 552 Pa. 200, 713 A.2d 1143, for purposes of oral argument. The Cross-Petition for Allowance of Appeal is denied. The Motion to File Answer to Brief in Opposition to Petition for Allowance of Appeal is granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Stephen A. Moore, James L. Fritz and John P. Neblett, Harrisburg, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
713 A.2d 1142
PINNACLE HEALTH HOSPITALS, Successor by Consolidation to Polyclinic Medical Center, Petitioner, v. DAUPHIN COUNTY BOARD OF ASSESSMENT APPEALS, County of Dauphin, School District of the City of Harrisburg, City of Harrisburg, Cross-Petitioner.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Aug. 7, 1998.
Stephen A. Moore, James L. Fritz and John P. Neblett, Harrisburg, for petitioner.
